section.title: Description
section.p: This tool adds a group. This tool is a centralized version of groupadd. It runs on OAME nodes and distributes the operation to all the specified nodes. The options applicable to groupadd are directly passed to it. For information on groupadd options, see groupadd manual.

row.entry: Continues to run the previously failed operation.
Forces to run the current operation regardless of previous failures.
Displays this help message and exits.
Specifies which host names (comma-separated) the operation is applied to. The internal IP addresses can also be used. Overrides -T.

entry.p: Specifies which node types (comma-separated) the operation is applied to.

li.p: for ME: all, auxiliary, cdr, comsvc, db, diameterapp, iohd, ioho, oame
for SM: all, auxiliary, db, ioho, oame, smapp

row.entry: Exits successfully if the group already exists, and cancels -g if the GID is already used.
Uses GID for the new group.
Allows to create groups with duplicate (non-unique) UID.
Uses this encrypted password for the new group.

fig.codeblock: [root@sps-me-oame-0 ~]# /opt/tpa/sbin/add-group -T all group1 <2018.12.04 16:03:07 -0500><sps-me-oame-0><add-group> INFO: Checking if the current operation is allowed. <2018.12.04 16:03:07 -0500><sps-me-oame-0><add-group> INFO: Taking the operation '/usr/sbin/groupadd -g group1 on 'all'. <2018.12.04 16:03:08 -0500><sps-me-oame-0><add-group> INFO: The operation succeeded on all target nodes. <2018.12.04 16:03:08 -0500><sps-me-oame-0><add-group> INFO: Done with success.
